name: Organization Ontology Glossary
description: Comprehensive glossary of terms defined in the Organization Ontology

terms.definition: Core organization entity representing any business, company, or entity within the platform ecosystem
terms.mappingRationale: Direct alignment with schema.org Organization type
terms.notes: Foundation entity referenced by all other organization-related ontologies

terms.definition: Unique identifier for an organization within the platform, following the pattern org:[a-z0-9-]+
terms.constraints: Pattern: org:[a-z0-9-]+, must be unique across all organizations
terms.notes: Used as primary key for organization lookups

terms.definition: Array of relationships an organization has with the platform, allowing multiple simultaneous relationship types
terms.mappingRationale: Custom property - no schema.org equivalent for multi-relationship platform membership
terms.constraints: Must contain at least one relationship object
terms.notes: Enables organizations to be both client AND affiliate simultaneously

terms.definition: Primary classification of an organization's role in the platform ecosystem
terms.mappingRationale: Custom enumeration specific to platform organization types
terms.constraints: Enum: PFI, Agency, Client, Affiliate, Partner, Competitor
terms.notes: Determines base permissions and visibility rules

terms.definition: Platform Framework Instance - the organization that operates the platform (e.g., BAIV)
terms.mappingRationale: Platform-specific concept with no schema.org equivalent
terms.constraints: Only one PFI per platform instance
terms.example: BAIV is the PFI for the AI Visibility platform
terms.notes: Has highest level of access and administrative privileges

terms.definition: Organization that manages multiple client organizations on behalf of those clients
terms.constraints: Can manage multiple clients, may also be a client themselves
terms.example: Marketing Agency XYZ manages 10 client accounts
terms.notes: Agency users can access all their managed client data

terms.definition: Method by which a client organization accesses the platform - either directly or through an agency
terms.constraints: Enum: direct, agency_managed. Only applicable when type=client
terms.notes: agency_managed requires managedBy to specify the managing agency

terms.definition: Reference to the agency organization that manages this client organization
terms.mappingRationale: Platform-specific relationship with no direct schema.org equivalent
terms.constraints: Required when tier=agency_managed, must reference valid Agency organization
terms.notes: Creates parent-child relationship for data access

terms.definition: Primary industry sector in which the organization operates
terms.constraints: Free text, should align with standard industry classifications
terms.notes: Used for industry-specific recommendations and benchmarking

terms.definition: Classification of organization size based on employee count
terms.mappingRationale: Custom enumeration with specific ranges for platform segmentation
terms.notes: Affects pricing tier and feature availability

terms.definition: Organization or individual that refers new clients to the platform in exchange for compensation
terms.constraints: Can be combined with other relationship types (e.g., client + affiliate)
terms.example: Foot Scientific is both a client and an affiliate

terms.definition: Organization identified as competing with another organization in the same market
terms.mappingRationale: Competitive analysis concept, tracked at multiple levels
terms.constraints: Can exist at platform level, client level, or client's client level
terms.example: Superfeet is a competitor of Foot Scientific
terms.notes: Competitors are tracked for citation monitoring and ranking comparison
